executive_summary: The Cigar Lounges industry's long-term decline has been accelerated by the COVID-19 pandemic. Cigar lounges took a large hit following the outbreak of coronavirus in the United States, which prompted a shutdown of nonessential businesses. Industry revenue plummeted 4.8% in 2020. Post-COVID growth was short lived, with revenue growing only 0.7% in 2021 before falling 7.4% in 2022. Overall, industry revenue has been falling at a CAGR of 2.1% over the past five years and is expected to reach $730.4 million through the end of 2023. This includes an estimated 1.8% drop in 2023 alone.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry Has Been Appealing to a Younger Audience
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Current smokers are the main buyers of industry products and are, in turn, the ultimate determinant of industry revenue. The industry has been developing a large consumer base among young adults that are increasingly more attracted to cigars than cigarettes.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Industry Has Been Benefiting From a Stable Economy
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: The industry has been benefiting from a growing and largely stable economy through the end of 2023.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Small, Localized Companies Dominate This Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Almost all industry enterprises operate only one establishment and employ only a few workers.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: External Competition Has An Effect On The Industry
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Online retailers have siphoned market share from cigar lounges through competitive prices and improved customer service.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: Hookah Lounges and Vape Shops Cater to Younger Smokers
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Cigar lounges have experienced growing external competition from hookah bars and vape shops.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Regulatory Crosswinds Will Affect the Industry
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: The regulatory landscape is expected to continue to have a significant influence on the performance of industry operations.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Cuban Cigars are in High Demand in the United States
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Cuban cigars are globally renowned for their distinctive taste and high quality.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Regulatory Impediments Are Expected to Hinder Industry Expansion
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Industry participation levels are likely to fall, as successful cigar lounge chains are expected to increase their national footprints.

industry_definition: This industry comprises businesses known as classic cigar bars or lounges, where patrons can purchase and smoke premium cigars in house.
key_trends: Stiff competition from vape shops and online retailers has hamstrung the industry.

market_segmentation.segment_description: Overall, this segment benefits from the same positive demand factors as the 25 to 44 range.
This segment has remained mostly stable through the end of 2023.
For this age range, leisure time is even higher due to the fact that the older portion of the range is approaching retirement.

products_and_services.product_description: CIGAR PRICES VARY BASED ON TOBACCO QUALITY, COUNTRY OF ORIGIN, SIZE AND AGE.
MANY ESTABLISHMENTS OFFER AN ASSORTMENT OF FOOD AND DRINK.
MANY ESTABLISHMENTS OFFER AN ASSORTMENT OF FOOD AND DRINK.

tier_1_suppliers: Beef & Pork Wholesaling in the US
Soft Drink, Baked Goods & Other Grocery Wholesaling in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Cigarette & Tobacco Products Wholesaling in the US
Wine & Spirits Wholesaling in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Individuals Ages 18 to 24 Demand Substitute Tobacco
demand_determinants.determinant_description: Compared with older demographics, this segment has less disposable income, higher amounts of debt and other financial restrictions.

business_locations.location_description: The Southeast holds the largest number of cigar lounges in the country.
The West is the second-largest region for cigar lounges despite extensive anti-smoking laws.
The Great Lakes region is the third-largest region for cigar lounges.

regulations_points.regulation_description: At the federal level, the only legislation governing indoor smoking pertains to smoking on airplanes.

regulations_points.regulation_title: THE TOBACCO CONTROL ACT AND NEW TOBACCO RULE
regulations_points.regulation_description: In June 2009, the Obama administration signed into law the Family Smoking Prevention and Tobacco Control Act.
In May 2012, Senators Dick Durbin, Frank Lautenberg and Richard Blumenthal introduced a bill that would create a tax hike on premium cigars.

basis_points.basis_title: Cigar lounges compete locally for business, especially in areas with sparse population.
basis_points.basis_description: In urban areas, cigar lounges serve a neighborhood or community.

basis_points.basis_title: Hookah lounges and vape shops pose the stiffest competition for cigar lounges.
basis_points.basis_description: These establishments siphon business from cigar lounges.

concentration_points.concentration_description: There are no major companies that dominate the landscape.

concentration_points.concentration_title: There is no consolidation in sight
concentration_points.concentration_description: Many of these lounges or bars are sole proprietorships that operate only one location.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Purchases are the largest expense for the industry
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Purchases are the largest expense for cigar lounges.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Profit has fallen as revenue shrinks
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Profit, measured as earnings before interest and taxes.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: Wages are a significant factor for any prospective cigar lounge operation.

FAQs.question: What is the Tobacco Tax Equity Act?
FAQs.answer: The Tobacco Tax Equity Act is a bill introduced in May 2012.

FAQs.question: What are some important industry associations and publications?
FAQs.answer: Important trade associations include Cigar Association of America.
